jpo
Class Tools

java.lang.Object
  jpo.Tools
public class Tools
extends java.lang.Object

sepearate class to hold a collection of static methods that are frequently needed.

setFilenameExtension

public static void setFilenameExtension(java.lang.String extension,
                                        javax.swing.JTextField jTextField)
method that tests the extension of the string in a JTextField for being the correct extension. If not the correct extension is added. The case of the extension is ignored.

correctFilenameExtension

public static java.io.File correctFilenameExtension(java.lang.String extension,
                                                    java.io.File testFile)
method that tests the file extension of a File object for being the correct extension. Either the same file object is returned or a new one is created with the correct extension. If not the correct extension is added. The case of the extension is ignored.

countfiles

public static int countfiles(java.io.File[] fileArray)
Counts the number of real files in the array of files.

Returns:
the number of real files in the array of files

jvmHasReader

public static boolean jvmHasReader(java.io.File testFile)
This method checks whether the JVM has an image reader for the supplied File.

Parameters:
testFile - The file to be checked
Returns:
true if the JVM has a reader false if not.

hasPictures

public static boolean hasPictures(java.io.File subDirectory)
This method looks into the supplied subdirectory and tries to see if there is at least one picture in it for which our Java Environment has a decoder.

Parameters:
subDirectory - The File representing the subdirectory to be recursively searched
Returns:
true if there is at leas one picture in the subdirectory, false if there is nothing.

                               java.net.URL b)
method to copy any file from a source location to a target location

copyPicture

public static long copyPicture(java.net.URL a,
                               java.io.File b)
method to copy any file from a source location to a target File location. Works better because files are writable whilst most URL are read only.

copyPicture

public static long copyPicture(java.io.File a,
                               java.io.File b)
method to copy any file from a source File to a target File location.

                                      java.io.BufferedOutputStream bout)
                               throws java.io.IOException
method to copy any file from a source stream to a output stream

Returns:
the crc of the file
Throws:
java.io.IOException

movePicture

public static boolean movePicture(java.net.URL a,
                                  java.net.URL b)
                           throws java.io.IOException
method to move any file from a source location to a target location. It checks whether the file was mentioned in the highres or lowres fields of other nodes and corrects those references if found.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

countPictures

public static int countPictures(SortableDefaultMutableTreeNode startNode)
count the number of pictures in a subtree. Useful for progress monitors.

sums the filesize of the pictures in a subtree.

searchClasspath

public static java.io.File searchClasspath(java.lang.String searchName)
searches for an item in the classpath that ends exactly like the supplied string. Returns a new file object for that item or null if not found. Invented to find the code classes of the JPO app which sit in jpo.jar file

log

public static void log(java.lang.String message)
writes a message to the logfile. There are several things that can go wrong here: The logfile path can be totally messed up i.e. not a valid filename. It could be non writable. In this case the error is reported and the log is shown on the screen.

closeLogfile

public static void closeLogfile()
proper way to close the logfile

inventPicURL

public static java.net.URL inventPicURL(java.io.File targetDir,
                                        java.lang.String startName)
method that returns a file handle for a picture that does not exist in the target directory. It tries the combination of path and name first and then tries to suffix _0 _1 _2 etc to the name. If that fails it combines random characters and then fails, returning null.

inventPicFilename

public static java.io.File inventPicFilename(java.io.File targetDir,
                                             java.lang.String startName)
method that returns a file handle for a picture that does not exist in the target directory. It tries the combination of path and name first and then tries to suffix _0 _1 _2 etc to the name. If that fails it combines random characters and then fails, returning null.

lowresFilename

public static java.lang.String lowresFilename()
method that returns a new lowres URL that has not been used before.

isUrlFile

public static boolean isUrlFile(java.net.URL testURL)
method that returns whether a URL is a file:// URL or not. Returns true if it is a file, false if it's anything else such as http://

freeMem

public static int freeMem()
convenience method to log the amount of free memory

stripOutFilenameRoot

public static java.lang.String stripOutFilenameRoot(java.io.File file)
method that strips out the root filename from a File object.

Example: c:\directory\geysir.jpg returns geysir

chooseXmlFile

public static java.io.File chooseXmlFile()
Method that chooses an xml file or returns null

setDragCursor

public static void setDragCursor(java.awt.dnd.DragSourceDragEvent event)
Analyses the drag event and sets the cursor to the appropriate style.

Parameters:
event - the DragSourceDragEvent for which the cursor is to be adjusted

calculateChecksum

public static long calculateChecksum(java.io.File f)
Calculates a checksum from the supplied File

Returns:
returns the checksum as a Long or Long.MIN_VALUE to indicate failure.

calculateChecksum

public static long calculateChecksum(java.io.InputStream in)
Calculates a checksum from the supplied input stream originally taken from: Java ist auch eine Insel (2. Aufl.) von Christian Ullenboom Programmieren für die Java 2-Plattform in der Version 1.4

Returns:
returns the checksum as a Long or Long.MIN_VALUE to indicate failure.

currentDate

public static java.lang.String currentDate(java.lang.String formatString)
returns the current date and time formatted per the formatting string. See the API doc on SimpleDateFormat for the meaning of the letters.

parseDate

public static java.util.Date parseDate(java.lang.String dateString)
This method tries it's best to parse the supplied date into a Java Date object.

Parameters:
dateString - the String to be parsed
Returns:
the Java Date object or null if it could not be parsed.

getScreenDimensions

public static java.awt.Rectangle getScreenDimensions()
This method uses some code I got off the web to dtermine the rectangle of the screen size. This is more complicated than it appears on the face of it because some users have multiple screens making up a large virtual desktop so the top left corner is not neccesarily (0,0).

Returns:
A rectangle with the coordinates of the desktop.

getJTextAreaDimension

public static java.awt.Dimension getJTextAreaDimension(javax.swing.JTextArea ta,
                                                       int horizontalWidth)
This method figures out the dimensions of the supplied JTextArea for it's current content. It is not terribly exact.

Parameters:
ta - The JTextArea for which you want to know the dimensions
horizontalWidth - The horizontal width that should be used in the dimension.
